intro: Gonzalagunia pulverulenta, commonly known as the powderflower, is a rare and unique flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its delicate, pale yellow to white flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves that are covered in a fine, powdery coating, which helps reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It is often found growing in rocky soils and is adapted to withstand extreme temperature fluctuations. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
